channel.title: Would this be possible?

item.title: Would this be possible?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:2, topic:275005”]If Jagex did it, you can do it. It’d probably be clientside, since in there you can change text colors, and add censors, etc. Just modify the censors.[/quote] Not client sided. It can be done client sided but server sided is easier, When you say your password it just opens an interface.

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be possible?
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

o.O O.o:

If Jagex did it, you can do it. It’d probably be clientside, since in there you can change text colors, and add censors, etc. Just modify the censors.

Alright, thanks.
But, how would you think it’d grab non-MD5 passwords? >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Would this be possible?
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

JaGeX has it so you cannot say your RuneScape password in-game. Do you think it might be possible?

		if (playerText.equalspass) {
			sendMessage("You cannot say your AnfernioScape password in-game.");
		}

Only problem is now I need to create a playerText void, lol.

So…
Do you think it’s possible?

Read full topic
